alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Madison; St. Clair (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 07 at 5:26PM CDT until May 07 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR WEST CENTRAL CLINTON COUNTY IN SOUTH CENTRAL ILLINOIS...SOUTHEASTERN MADISON AND NORTHEASTERN ST. CLAIR COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN ILLINOIS WILL EXPIRE AT 530 PM CDT... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and no longer poses an immediate threat to life or property. Therefore, the warning will be allowed to expire. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for south central and southwestern Illinois. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service St Louis. Remember, a Severe Thunderstorm Warning still remains in effect for southwestern Clinton County and southeastern St. Clair County until 6 pm.
